Reviews.Title: “gewoon goed”
Reviews.Author: maeann67
Reviews.Content: For the price you pay it is good. Small but functional and clean rooms. Very good breakfast

Reviews.Title: “A quiet place to stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: callmehans
Reviews.Content: Botel Zebra is located in the harbour area not far away from the city centre (10min walk?). it is - beeing a boat - pretty tiny and so the beds and baths aren't that big, too. The staff doesn't speak much english, but is friendly and helpful with information about amsterdam (food, parking etc.). the boat is clean and the breakfast is good (continental). there isn't much to complain about, except from the stairs that scare the hell out of you when your drunk or in comparable conditions... It is - as said in the title - a quiet place so you can step back from partying. There is a common room which is not that comfortable, but you will be straying around in the city anyway. i liked zebra - it gave our amsterdam trip something special.

Reviews.Title: “good stay”
Reviews.Author: pjotr77
Reviews.Content: Very good for the price you pay. Friendly and helpful staff, Small but functionally and clean rooms with private bathroom and toilet. Very good breakfast Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Sunkissedguy
Reviews.Content: Had a pleasant stay in amsterdam with amsterdam. The botel is located near the Amsterdam Centraal Station, (10 minutes walk) just look the NEMO science center ( the green shiplike building). The space is clean and cozy. Excellent water pressure (had a nice bath!) They serve excellent selection of breakfast (cereals, pastries, fruits, and different types of cheese!) The hospitality is very warm and i had a nice time and will definitely comeback here :) Experience Amsterdam in a unique way by checking in a botel!

Reviews.Title: “Was put off by the bad reviews but VERY surprised!!”
Reviews.Author: Rach1987_11
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here, i think some of the reviews are very over exagerate. The rooms were small, but there was enough room to get changed, have a shower, and sleep comfortably. The moisture on the ceiling only occurs if the shower door is open or the port hole is not open, this only happened to us on the last day, but my boyfriend and i both had showers everyday and had no problems at all. If you don't want a wet floor - put towels down. The atmosphere of the hotel was relaxed and really nice, the staff were very helpful and not at all rude. Breakfast is continental as is with most hotels and hostels (this was our 7th visit to Amsterdam), there is a fruit bread, bread rolls, cereal, coffee, tea, orange juice, yoghurt etc. We thought the botel had a very nice quirky feel and we will be DEFINATELY be booking to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for two nights and it was fine.”
Reviews.Author: meeshy9842
Reviews.Content: I've read a lot of negative reviews for this place both on TripAdvisor and on HostelWorld and I have to say, I didn't think it was that bad. We only stayed for two nights, and although I wouldn't say it was the best lodging I've ever had...it was safe, it had free wifi, and it was clean enough. I wouldn't recommend it for a long stay, especially if you consider yourself a more high maintenance person. The rooms are really just for sleeping (very small) and the bathroom situation is...temperamental (their toilet system is prone to having issues), but overall, you get what you paid for and it is relatively cheap considering it is Amsterdam. I'm going to say 'yes' to recommending this hotel, but I really only direct this towards people traveling on a budget or planning on a short stay in Amsterdam. Otherwise, I suggest looking elsewhere. PS something not listed on HostelWorld: they have a dog, for those of you with allergies.

Reviews.Title: “What an experience!”
Reviews.Author: nixpixi
Reviews.Content: Botel Zebra's cabins are soooooo tiny and not very clean. The beds are made for 5 year olds. The tiny bathrooms are dirty and the shower curtains might be 100 years old. The "continental" breakfast consist of dry old bread and tasteless cold meet. I would really not recommend this botel to ladies or "romantic couples". Hope this helps. ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Would never go back!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Neo27
Reviews.Content: Extremely tiny rooms, so much humidity inside the rooms you can't barely breathe, you can see water drops everywhere because of the humidity, toilet doesn't flush properly. I stayed there for 3 nights and I couldn't sleep at all, the first night I was shivering, the second night we turned on the heating and it was so hot it was unbreathable. On the third night we found ourselves another hotel nest to central station and it felt like a palace. Themlocation was good, and the breatfast was ok, the lady and the man there were very friendly, but honestly, this botel is deterred, there's hardly any cleaning, it's uncomfortable, small, cold, humid, noisy(due to paper thin walls), and the list of negative aspects goes on and on and on...

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay there!”
Reviews.Author: Nomad77London
Reviews.Content: This Botel is tiny, the rooms are tiny. I didn't like the fact that there was no area to sit in on the boat. Other boats in that area were available after hours to hang out in, in this one it was your cramped, pea sized room or outside. I didn't find the owners very welcoming at all, getting just a grunt from male in the living area. The family's living area is the same as the restaurant/ bar area. The breakfast was terrible, nothing hot at all The rooms were small and cramped , they were also freezing and smelt quite bit. I had other friends in other hotels, with proper hotel rooms in a more central location and they were paying less money!

Reviews.Title: “The cabins of this botel need a serious cleaning”
Reviews.Author: bunnymen
Reviews.Content: 1. upsides: there are only two good points about this botel: breakfast is good (the cook is a very nice filipino guy) and so is its location, walking distance from the Central Station. 2. downsides: We spent 4 nights here and, as we had to pay cash upfront, could not leave after our 1st night. The cabin is incredibly small, about 2x3 m or 7x10 ft. Two people can barely move inside. The bathroom is dirty and there's mould all over the curtains. As we could see every morning, the ceiling sweats all over the cabin and the water drips from above, due to the temperature difference between inside and the water outside. The humidity inside was so intense that our clothes were humid, almost wet. The mirror is small and we could barely use it due to the humidity. The shower was poor. In a nutshell, for the same price or slightly more you can find much better accomodation in Amsterdam. I guess this is why they ask payment in cash upfront only.

HotelInfo.Name: Botel Zebra
HotelInfo.Address: PO Box 2430, Amsterdam 1000CK, The Netherlands
